decks.notes: This deck focuses on achieving control through a combination of countering opponent's spells, clearing the board with Day of Judgment, and utilizing the powerful planeswalker Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The key concept is to establish early board presence with Stoneforge Mystic and Squadron Hawk, while protecting oneself with counterspells like Mana Leak and Stoic Rebuttal. The deck also benefits from the equipment Sword of Feast and Famine and Sylvok Lifestaff to enhance creatures and gain life. The mana base includes utility lands like Tectonic Edge and Celestial Colonnade for added advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressive play creatures with landfall abilities to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It focuses on efficiently playing lands, utilizing cards like Arid Mesa, Evolving Wilds, and Marsh Flats to trigger landfall abilities and boost the power of creatures like Plated Geopede and Steppe Lynx. The deck also includes equipment like Adventuring Gear and Sword of Body and Mind to further strengthen the creatures. Additionally, there are control elements like Journey to Nowhere and Lightning Bolt to remove threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up landfall triggers to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. By consistently playing and sacrificing lands, it can trigger powerful abilities like +1/+1 counters, extra card draw, and removal. This Boros Landfall deck utilizes efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Mirran Crusader to apply pressure early on, while also having access to removal spells like Arc Trail and Journey to Nowhere to control the board. Additionally, it includes equipment like Sword of Body and Mind to further enhance its creatures and provide additional avenues for victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells like Day of Judgment and counterspells like Deprive, while also utilizing creatures like Squadron Hawk and Sun Titan for value. It aims to generate card advantage through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Preordain, while also using equipment like Sword of Body and Mind and Sword of Feast and Famine to improve its creatures' abilities. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Elspeth Tirel and Gideon Jura for additional board presence and versatility, making it a well-rounded control deck with a focus on efficient removal and card advantage.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay and completing the Holy Quest. It utilizes a combination of low-cost creatures such as Glint Hawk, Kor Skyfisher, and Squadron Hawk to establish a strong board presence and enable the activation of abilities like Fauna Shaman. The deck also includes cards like Vengevine and Argentum Armor to provide additional power and versatility. The key strategy is to quickly complete the Quest for the Holy Relic and equip powerful artifacts like Sword of Body and Mind to further enhance the aggression and dominance of the deck.

The focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, board wipes, and efficient creatures. The goal is to stabilize the board with Day of Judgment while utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Stoneforge Mystic to generate card advantage and provide threats. The inclusion of Sword of Feast and Famine adds another win condition and the ability to disrupt opponents' resources. By carefully managing resources and controlling the pace of the game, this deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through a combination of control and efficient threats.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the board through various removal spells and counterspells while also utilizing powerful equipment like Sword of Body and Mind and Sword of Feast and Famine to gain an advantage. Stoneforge Mystic is used to tutor for these equipment pieces, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and control. The deck aims to establish a strong defensive position with cards like Mirran Crusader and Tectonic Edge, ultimately setting up for a powerful win condition with the equipped creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of artifacts, removal spells, and planeswalkers. The deck utilizes Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas as the main win condition, while also utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Mindslaver for additional control. The deck also includes various artifacts such as Everflowing Chalice and Sphere of the Suns to generate mana and provide utility. Removal spells like Pyroclasm and Galvanic Blast help keep the opponent's board clear, allowing the player to maintain control of the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures equipped with Swords to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to set up a strong defense with Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura while using Stoneforge Mystic to search for the appropriate Sword for the situation. The deck also includes a Sun Titan for recursion and Squadron Hawks for card advantage. Overall, it looks to out-value the opponent and maintain board control to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various means such as countering spells with Stoic Rebuttal and Mana Leak, disrupting opponent's hand with Inquisition of Kozilek, and controlling the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Black Sun's Zenith. The deck also aims to control the opponent's resources by utilizing cards like Spreading Seas and Tectonic Edge to disrupt their mana base. Ultimately, the deck looks to establish board presence with powerful threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Grave Titan while keeping the opponent's options limited.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Khalni Heart Expedition, Harrow, and Cultivate to get out Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan as fast as possible. Once Valakut is in play, the deck can deal massive amounts of damage by triggering Valakut's ability with multiple Mountains entering the battlefield at once. The deck also utilizes cards like Lotus Cobra and Avenger of Zendikar to generate additional mana and create an army of plant tokens to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up powerful mana and card advantage engines, such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Stoneforge Mystic. The key strategy of the deck is to control the board with removal spells like Day of Judgment and Condemn, while leveraging powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Sword of Body and Mind to generate value and close out the game with efficient threats like Sun Titan and Squadron Hawk. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Tectonic Edge and Celestial Colonnade.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats with targeted removal, and utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Garruk Wildspeaker. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Explore, allowing the player to play big threats like Inferno Titan and Precursor Golem. The land base is optimized for consistent mana production and includes utility lands like Scalding Tarn and Halimar Depths. Overall, this deck focuses on controlling the board and winning through powerful spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful landfall creatures and trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal damage to opponents. Cards like Khalni Heart Expedition, Harrow, and Explore help accelerate mana growth, while Green Sun's Zenith tutors for key creatures like Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar. Oracle of Mul Daya provides additional land drops, Lotus Cobra generates extra mana, and Valakut deals damage with each landfall trigger. The deck aims to control the board with these powerful creatures and win the game through a combination of ramping and direct damage.

This deck focuses on the aggressive playstyle of Vampires, utilizing low-cost creatures and direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By constantly applying pressure and gaining incremental advantages with creature removal and life gain triggers, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and keep the opponent on the back foot. The inclusion of cards like Bloodghast and Kalastria Highborn allows for resilience and additional value, while the mana base ensures consistency and efficient resource utilization. Overall, the deck seeks to dominate the early game and close out the match before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a variety of cheap and aggressive creatures and spells. The key strategy involves generating tokens through cards like Kuldotha Rebirth and then using cards like Devastating Summons and Chimeric Mass to push for a final burst of damage. Signal Pest and Goblin Bushwhacker are used to buff the board and increase the overall damage output, while cards like Galvanic Blast and Lightning Bolt provide direct damage to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to win the game swiftly before the opponent can establish their own board presence.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of low-cost artifact creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Mox Opal, Kuldotha Rebirth, Galvanic Blast, and Devastating Summons to deal damage efficiently. The aggressive strategy is supported by cards that provide additional benefits to your creatures, such as Flayer Husk and Chimeric Mass. By flooding the battlefield with creatures like Signal Pest, Ornithopter, Memnite, Goblin Guide, and Goblin Bushwhacker, and utilizing Contested War Zone, this deck aims to take control of the game early and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counter spells and removal to dominate the game. It includes powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Stoneforge Mystic to gain card advantage and control the board. The swords and creatures like Squadron Hawk and Sun Titan provide additional threats and value. The mana base is designed to support the control strategy, with utility lands like Tectonic Edge and Celestial Colonnade. The main goal is to control the game until victory is secured through card advantage and powerful creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage provided by Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Spell Pierce and Stoic Rebuttal, while also generating value with Squadron Hawk and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck also includes cards like Gideon Jura and Day of Judgment for board control, and Sword of Feast and Famine for additional win conditions. The mana base is focused on producing the necessary colors for spells and lands to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a powerful board presence through low-cost creatures and artifacts, while also utilizing Quest for the Holy Relic to search for and equip Argentum Armor to dominate the battlefield. By efficiently utilizing the Aggro strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced offense, supported by cards like Steppe Lynx, Squadron Hawk, Signal Pest, and Accorder Paladin. The inclusion of land-fetching cards like Marsh Flats and Arid Mesa ensures consistent mana production for an aggressive and relentless assault on the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy. It utilizes powerful spells and creatures to maintain board control while utilizing mana efficiently. The key strategy involves using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Mana Leak to control the opponent's plays, while also ramping up mana with Lotus Cobra and Birds of Paradise. The deck also includes threats like Inferno Titan and Thrun, the Last Troll to both control the board and finish off the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a powerful board presence through aggressive creatures and equipment. By utilizing cards like Quest for the Holy Relic and Fauna Shaman to search for key pieces like Sword of Body and Mind and Argentum Armor, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures like Vengevine and Squadron Hawk. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Ornithopter and Glint Hawk for early game pressure. With a focus on efficient mana usage and card advantage, the deck aims to establish early dominance and push for victory.

The key strategy of this deck is to maintain board control by using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura. The deck also utilizes Stoneforge Mystic to search for and equip Sword of Feast and Famine, providing additional control and card advantage. Squadron Hawk helps to maintain card advantage, while Tectonic Edge and Celestial Colonnade provide additional utility and threat. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually gaining card advantage and ultimately overwhelming them with powerful threats.

This Blade Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards, including Swords, counterspells, removal, and planeswalkers, to manipulate the board state and protect key threats like Sun Titan and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck aims to control the game through countering threats, removing problematic permanents, and generating card advantage with Squadron Hawk and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The mana base includes utility lands like Tectonic Edge and Celestial Colonnade to provide additional control options and win conditions. The deck excels at disrupting the opponent's game plan while establishing its own threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board using Tezzeret's abilities and a variety of artifacts. Tumble Magnet and Throne of Geth are used to control enemy creatures, while Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide card advantage and manipulation. The deck also includes removal spells like Ratchet Bomb and Stoic Rebuttal to deal with threats. With an emphasis on artifact synergy and control elements, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing its own dominance on the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Lotus Cobra and Harrow, in order to play high-cost cards like Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar. By utilizing Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and cards like Khalni Heart Expedition, the deck aims to deal large amounts of direct damage to the opponent. With the ability to control the board through cards like Oracle of Mul Daya and Raging Ravine, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and burn spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through removal spells like Slagstorm and Pyroclasm while ramping up mana with cards like Harrow and Khalni Heart Expedition. The deck aims to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures. Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle serves as a win condition, dealing direct damage to the opponent when triggering its ability. The deck focuses on efficiently mana ramping and controlling the board until it can establish a strong board presence and win the game.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing creatures with powerful abilities and efficient removal spells, the deck aims to maintain board control and pressure the opponent early on in the game. The deck also includes mana-fixing lands to ensure smooth mana curve while maintaining a fast-paced assault. By combining creatures with useful abilities and removal spells, the deck is able to consistently apply pressure and force the opponent to react defensively, leading to potential victories through quick and aggressive strategies.

The deck focuses on quickly playing creatures with landfall abilities to apply pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic to search for equipment and Lightning Bolt for removal, the deck aims to control the board while maintaining a steady flow of aggressive creatures. With a mix of powerful attackers like Goblin Guide and Steppe Lynx, along with efficient land fetchers like Terramorphic Expanse and fetch lands, the deck can quickly build up a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this Boros Landfall deck is to quickly build up mana by playing a landfall creature each turn and using spells like Lightning Bolt to clear the way for attacks. The deck also has a strong equipment package with Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful swords that can provide additional benefits. The aggressive creatures like Steppe Lynx, Plated Geopede, and Goblin Guide put pressure on the opponent early on, with finishers like Hero of Oxid Ridge and Mirran Crusader to close out the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats.

The main concept of this Boros Landfall deck is to utilize landfall triggers to quickly pump up your creatures and overwhelm your opponent with aggressive attacks. By consistently playing lands and triggering landfall abilities, such as those on Steppe Lynx and Plated Geopede, you can quickly build a strong board presence and put pressure on your opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Sword of Body and Mind further enhances the power of your creatures, making them even more threatening in combat.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Boros creatures that benefit from landfall triggers, such as Steppe Lynx and Plated Geopede. By using cards like Goblin Guide and Squadron Hawk to maintain pressure, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere to control the board, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Additionally, the inclusion of equipment like Sword of Body and Mind and Sword of Feast and Famine provides additional threats and utility to close out the game efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive vampire creatures and efficient removal spells. By playing small, evasive creatures like Vampire Lacerator and Pulse Tracker, combined with powerful vampire lords like Kalastria Highborn and Captivating Vampire, the deck can deal damage quickly and efficiently. Utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Arc Trail for removal, along with creatures like Viscera Seer and Gatekeeper of Malakir for disruption, the deck aims to control the board while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total to achieve victory.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively attack with a swarm of vampires while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Arc Trail to deal additional damage to both creatures and opponents. The deck also utilizes cards like Dark Tutelage and Viscera Seer for card advantage and manipulation. Additionally, the deck includes creatures like Vampire Hexmage and Kalastria Highborn to disrupt opposing strategies and gain additional benefits. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and targeted removal spells.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost aggressive Vampire creatures and efficiently remove any blockers or threats with direct damage or removal spells. It also utilizes sacrificing creatures for various benefits and draining the opponent's life with cards like Kalastria Highborn. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to both black and red mana to cast spells and creatures efficiently. The overall strategy is to maintain board control while quickly depleting the opponent's life total to secure victory.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive vampire creatures and disrupting the opponent with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Duress. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat and creatures like Gatekeeper of Malakir, while putting pressure on the opponent with fast creatures like Vampire Lacerator and Pulse Tracker. The deck also includes counterspells like Unified Will and a mix of lands to ensure consistent mana production. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with an early aggressive start and control the game to secure a victory.

The main strategy of this deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up its own mana production with cards like Lotus Cobra and Explore. The deck also includes powerful threats like Grave Titan and Frost Titan to close out the game once control has been established. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a variety of control tools and abilities. It aims to slow down the opponent's progress and disrupt their strategies. The deck includes powerful creatures such as Avenger of Zendikar, Frost Titan, and Grave Titan, which can provide additional control and threaten the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Lotus Cobra and Oracle of Mul Daya to accelerate mana generation and card advantage. Additionally, it utilizes counterspells like Mana Leak, removal spells like Disfigure and Go for the Throat, and disruption spells like Memoricide to hinder the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while advancing its own win condition through cards like Luminarch Ascension and Celestial Colonnade. The deck utilizes a mix of card advantage, board wipes, and creature threats to maintain control and outvalue the opponent. By efficiently answering threats and generating card advantage, this deck aims to grind out the opponent until it can secure a win through its powerful planeswalkers and land creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Quest for the Holy Relic and Fauna Shaman to quickly search for and equip powerful artifacts such as Sword of Body and Mind and Argentum Armor. The deck also includes strong aggressive creatures like Vengevine and Squadron Hawk to apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck has multiple ways to return creatures to hand or play them for extra value, such as Kor Skyfisher and Glint Hawk. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful equipment.

The deck focuses on controlling the board using counterspells and removal spells like Stoic Rebuttal, Spell Pierce, and Day of Judgment. The key win condition is to equip Stoneforge Mystic with either Sylvok Lifestaff or Sword of Feast and Famine to generate value and tempo advantage. Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura provide additional control and threats. The deck also utilizes card advantage through Preordain and Squadron Hawk, while maintaining a solid mana base with Tectonic Edge, Seachrome Coast, and Celestial Colonnade.

The focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing countermagic, removal, and card advantage from Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to maintain board control by consistently wiping the board with Day of Judgment and using Stoneforge Mystic to search for equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine to help close out the game. The deck also has a strong mana denial strategy with Tectonic Edge and aims to win through card advantage and incremental advantage.

The primary strategy of this deck is to control the board through removal spells like Day of Judgment and counterspells like Stoic Rebuttal and Mana Leak. The deck also utilizes equipment cards like Sword of Feast and Famine and Sylvok Lifestaff to gain advantage in combat. The main win condition comes from powerful planeswalkers Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura, along with the creature package of Stoneforge Mystic and Squadron Hawk. The mana base is focused on providing consistent access to white and blue mana sources to support the control strategy.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary components to power up and equip the Argentum Armor through the use of Quest for the Holy Relic. This aggro strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of low-cost creatures like Signal Pest, Ornithopter, and Memnite, while also utilizing cards like Contested War Zone and Squadron Hawk to maintain card advantage and battlefield presence. The efficient use of mana sources like Marsh Flats and Arid Mesa ensures a consistent flow of creatures onto the battlefield to pressure the opponent and achieve victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win conditions with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Sword of Feast and Famine, and Wurmcoil Engine. With a combination of card draw, mana acceleration, and versatile threats, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent over the long game and secure victory through careful planning and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through efficient counterspells and removal, while also ramping up mana with cards like Lotus Cobra and Explore. The deck aims to stabilize the board with powerful threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Titans, while also generating value through card advantage and land drops. The deck can quickly switch from defense to offense with powerful finishers like Inferno Titan and Avenger of Zendikar. It also has the flexibility to adapt to different situations with its diverse card pool and land base.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures enhanced by the Tempered Steel enchantment. By playing low-cost artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Signal Pest, along with Steel Overseer, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently. Cards like Mox Opal and Seachrome Coast help to ramp up mana production, while Contested War Zone provides additional damage potential. The strategy focuses on early aggression and leveraging the power of artifact creatures to dominate the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of artifact creatures powered up by Tempered Steel. By using cards like Signal Pest and Steel Overseer, along with cheap artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Memnite, this deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of Ajani Goldmane and Mox Opal provides additional support and ramp for the deck. With a low land count and a focus on aggressive plays, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can set up any defenses.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using various artifacts and spells, leveraging Tezzeret's abilities to gain card advantage and lock down the opponent's board. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with Sphere of the Suns and Everflowing Chalice, while using cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also contains win conditions such as Blightsteel Colossus and Myr Battlesphere, with Kuldotha Forgemaster able to tutor for these powerful threats. Ultimately, this deck excels at outlasting opponents and locking down the game until it can secure a win.

The concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and disrupting their hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck aims to control the board with planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and finish the game with powerful threats like Grave Titan. The deck also includes land destruction with Tectonic Edge and powerful removal spells like Go for the Throat and Doom Blade. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and flexibility in spells casting.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Mana Leak, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Black Sun's Zenith. The deck aims to establish card advantage and board presence with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and strong finishers like Grave Titan and Wurmcoil Engine. The inclusion of Spreading Seas and Tectonic Edge helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while efficient creatures like Vampire Nighthawk provide additional value and protection.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to protect its powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor while using cards like Inquisition of Kozilek to strip the opponent's hand of threats. Cards like Grave Titan and Vampire Nighthawk provide threats of their own, while cards like Tectonic Edge and Spreading Seas help to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck's goal is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory is assured.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by ramping up mana quickly using cards like Harrow, Khalni Heart Expedition, and Explore to eventually play Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar. By utilizing Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle with the high number of Mountains in the deck, you can deal massive amounts of direct damage to your opponent's creatures or life total. The deck aims to consistently search for and play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle as soon as possible to start the damage output.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful landfall creatures and spells that can control the board and deal large amounts of direct damage. By utilizing cards like Cultivate, Harrow, and Oracle of Mul Daya to quickly get Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle online, the deck can turn every land drop into a potential lethal blow. Primeval Titan and Avenger of Zendikar serve as powerful threats that can quickly overwhelm opponents while Lightning Bolt provides some removal and reach. The deck aims to control the game until it can secure a win through its Valakut shenanigans.
